events.title: Mild Week
events.text: The river flows calmly this week. People feel safe, almost forgetting the old prophecy.

choices.text: Let them celebrate by the river.
Remind them to be careful and save water.

events.title: Harvest Festival
events.text: The yearly harvest festival is approaching. The council asks if it should be as grand as before.

choices.text: Hold a grand festival as always.
Keep it small and modest this year.
Replace the festival with a river blessing ritual.

events.title: Debris in the Current
events.text: Fishers report strange debris and darker mud carried by the current.

choices.text: Send the young scholar to investigate.
Blame upstream villages and ignore it.

events.title: Children at the Shallows
events.text: Children play at the shallow edge of the river, laughing and splashing.

choices.text: Let them play. They need joy.
Move them away and forbid play near the river.
Build a safer water pool away from the current.

events.title: Temple Whisper
events.text: The river priests say they feel a faint unease in the flow of the water.

choices.text: Allow a small thanksgiving ritual.
Tell them not to worry the people.

events.title: Old Well
events.text: An old, half-buried well to the north might still hold water if cleared.

choices.text: Send workers to reopen the old well.
Ask the priests to read signs before touching it.
Leave it buried; focus on the river instead.

events.title: Shortage Rumors
events.text: Rumors spread that grain stores are already lower than last year.

choices.text: Publicly deny the rumors.
Announce mild rationing of bread.

events.title: Migrating Birds
events.text: Birds that usually follow the river leave earlier than expected.

choices.text: Order hunters to follow the birds and observe.
Call it a superstition and do nothing.
Ask the scholar to record the timing carefully.

events.title: First Hairline Cracks
events.text: Fine cracks appear in the dry patches of riverbank near the lower village.

choices.text: Send builders to reinforce the banks.
Hold a small vigil at the cracks.

events.title: The Old Prophecy
events.text: A wandering storyteller repeats the ancient words: 'One day, the river will stop.'

choices.text: Let people listen. They must remember.
Silence the storyteller to avoid panic.
Invite the storyteller to speak only in council.

events.title: Numbers on Clay
events.text: The scholar asks for clay tablets and workers to record monthly water levels.

choices.text: Provide what is needed for careful records.
Too early for such effort; refuse.

events.title: Uneasy Stillness
events.text: One morning, the river seems oddly quiet. No one else seems to notice.

choices.text: Ignore it; perhaps it is only in your mind.
Spend the morning walking alone by the river.

events.title: Measured Decline
events.text: The scholar presents clay tablets: the water level has fallen each month without fail.

choices.text: Share the data openly with the people.
Keep the records within the council.
Blame the scholar for sowing fear.

events.title: Cracking Fields
events.text: Farmers show you soil that splits under their feet.

choices.text: Divert more water to the fields.
Protect drinking water; sacrifice some crops.
Launch a soil study with the scholar.

events.title: Whispers at the Temple
events.text: Priests claim the river spirit is restless and demands a larger ritual.

choices.text: Approve a grand ritual with offerings.
Allow only a simple prayer.
Refuse; insist on practical measures only.

events.title: Crowded Wells
events.text: Lines at the wells grow longer. Tempers flare in the heat.

choices.text: Send guards to impose strict order.
Ask volunteers to mediate disputes.

events.title: First Exodus Talk
events.text: A small group quietly suggests leaving the valley to look for other rivers.

choices.text: Allow them to leave as a small scout group.
Forbid such talk; it weakens resolve.
Invite them to share what they see, if they return.

events.title: Unequal Storage
events.text: It is discovered that wealthy homes have hidden water jars.

choices.text: Confiscate the extra water for public stores.
Tax them lightly and let them keep most.
Look away; stability is more important.

events.title: Sickness by the Bank
events.text: People who bathed in a stagnant pool of the river fall ill.

choices.text: Ban bathing in the river entirely.
Open healing tents and treat them.

events.title: Council Dispute
events.text: The scholar, the high priest, and the captain of the guard argue loudly in council.

choices.text: Support the scholar's call for careful planning.
Support the priest's demand for more rituals.
Support the captain's push for strict control.
Ask them all to compromise.

events.title: Dry Tributary
events.text: A side stream that once fed the river is now only cracked earth.

choices.text: Send a small team to map the dry stream bed.
Hold a mourning walk along the empty path.

events.title: Bread or Guards
events.text: Resources are limited: you can either boost food distribution or increase patrols.

choices.text: Prioritize bread for the hungry.
Prioritize more guards at wells and stores.
Attempt a balanced but complex plan.

events.title: Return of the Scouts
events.text: The small group you once allowed to leave returns, dusty and exhausted.

choices.text: Welcome them publicly and hear their report.
Question them in private first.

events.title: Broken Wheel
events.text: A main water cart breaks while carrying jars uphill.

choices.text: Repair and reinforce all carts.
Blame the workers for negligence.

events.title: Nighttime Panic
events.text: At night, a rumor spreads: 'The river will vanish by dawn.' People rush to the banks.

choices.text: Calm the crowd with a speech.
Disperse them with guards.
Hold a quiet vigil with lanterns.

events.title: The First Dry Day
events.text: For one full day, no new water seems to flow from upstream. Only what remains in pools and wells.

choices.text: Treat it as a warning and begin strict rationing.
Assume it is temporary and reassure everyone.

events.title: Empty Stones
events.text: Large stones that were once underwater now stand exposed in the center of the riverbed.

choices.text: Mark this as the 'First Turning' in the records.
Hold a silent walk among the stones.

events.title: Fading Hope
events.text: Some families quietly pack their belongings at night.

choices.text: Permit those who wish to leave, but record their names.
Order everyone to stay; no more departures.
Ask them to wait until a council decision is made.

events.title: Last Ritual Request
events.text: The high priest speaks: 'If we are to save anything, one last great ritual must be held.'

choices.text: Agree and devote food and water to the ritual.
Refuse; these resources must go to survival.

events.title: Deep Cracks
events.text: Deep fissures split the old riverbed. Some say they hear a hollow echo from below.

choices.text: Send ropes and a team to explore.
Declare the fissures sacred and untouchable.
Fill the most dangerous cracks near the village.

events.title: Dried Mouths
events.text: Children line up at the well with cracked lips and hollow eyes.

choices.text: Give them extra rations from reserves.
Hold to the strict ration rules.

events.title: Council at the Edge
events.text: The scholar, the priest, and the captain stand with you at the dry river's edge, awaiting your direction.

choices.text: Choose the scholar's plan: wells, cisterns, and careful engineering.
Choose the priest's path: accept the prophecy, perform the final rites.
Choose the captain's rule: strict survival for the strongest.
Choose to prepare for a great migration.

events.title: Dust Storm
events.text: A wind of dust sweeps through the the valley, turning the sky red-brown.

choices.text: Tell everyone to shelter inside and seal their homes.
Open communal shelters in stronger buildings.

events.title: Echo of Water
events.text: In the night, some swear they heard, just once, the sound of flowing water.

choices.text: Search the valley for hidden springs.
Call it a dream and tell people to rest.

events.title: The Last Pool
events.text: Only one broad, muddy pool remains where the river once sang.

choices.text: Protect it with guards; only the chosen may drink.
Let all drink freely one last time.
Use it to fill cisterns and containers.

events.title: The Silent Day
events.text: The day arrives when no trickle, no ripple, no sound of water reaches the valley.

choices.text: Gather everyone to speak of what comes next.
Retreat to council chambers and plan in secret.

events.title: Finale: The Last River
events.text: The riverbed is dust and stone. No migration prepared, no new source found. The people linger, then fade.

choices.text: Accept that this valley has reached its end.

events.title: Finale: Caravan of Dust
events.text: Carts are loaded, children carried, the old helped onto wagons. The people leave the dead river behind in search of a new flow.

choices.text: Lead the people away from the valley.

events.title: Finale: Rite of the Dry River
events.text: Torches circle the empty bed as prayers rise. Whether water returns or not, the people find meaning in the end.

choices.text: Stand with them as the last rite is spoken.

events.title: Finale: Wells of Memory
events.text: Cisterns, wells, and carved channels now bind what little water can be found. The river is gone, but the settlement endures.

choices.text: Oversee the first day without the river.
